Class Stock

java.lang.Object
Stock
All Implemented Interfaces:
MarketObserver
public class Stock extends Object implements MarketObserver
The Stock class models a stock in a simulation, tracking its price and share history. It follows the Singleton pattern to ensure a single consistent stock instance exists during runtime. This class also implements the MarketObserver interface to react to market updates and acts as an observable for all registered StockObserver instances (e.g., Buyers).

  • Constructor Details

    • Stock

      private Stock(double currentPrice, int shares)
      Private constructor for the Singleton pattern. Initializes the stock with an initial price and share count.
      Parameters:
      currentPrice - initial price of the stock
      shares - initial number of available shares

  • Method Details

    • getTrackedsize

      public int getTrackedsize()
      Returns the number of price entries stored (used for calculating trends).
      Returns:
      the size of the tracked price history

    • getInstance

      public static Stock getInstance(double startingPrice, int shares)
      Returns the singleton instance of the stock, creating it if necessary.
      Parameters:
      startingPrice - the initial price to use if the instance doesn't exist
      shares - the initial number of shares
      Returns:
      the singleton instance

    • addObserver

      void addObserver(StockObserver observer)
      Registers a new observer that will be notified on stock price updates.
      Parameters:
      observer - the observer to add

    • getPriceAt

      double getPriceAt(int time)
      Retrieves the stock price at a specific point in time.
      Parameters:
      time - the index in the trackedPrices list
      Returns:
      the stock price at the given time

    • getTrend

      double getTrend(int given)
      Calculates the average stock price over the last 'given' entries.
      Parameters:
      given - the number of recent prices to average
      Returns:
      the average price over that window

    • AVGAvalibleShares

      int AVGAvalibleShares()
      Calculates the average number of available shares recorded in the history.
      Returns:
      the average of tracked available shares

    • getCurrentPrice

      double getCurrentPrice()
      Gets the current market price of the stock.
      Returns:
      the latest stock price

    • ForcedStock

      void ForcedStock(ArrayList<Double> ForcedMarketPrices)
      Forces the stock's price history to a custom list (used for testing or replays).
      Parameters:
      ForcedMarketPrices - the list of historical prices to inject

    • NotifyBuyers

      void NotifyBuyers()
      Notifies all registered observers (e.g., Buyers) about the latest price update.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Provides a summary of the stock's latest price and share count.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      formatted string of current stock state

    • updateMarketState

      public void updateMarketState(int shares, double price)
      Called when the market updates its state. Stores new price and share count, updates current price, and notifies all observers.
      Specified by:
      updateMarketState in interface MarketObserver
      Parameters:
      shares - number of shares available
      price - the new market price of the stock

    • printAsciiPriceGraph

      public void printAsciiPriceGraph()
      Prints a simple ASCII graph of historical stock prices to the console. Useful for debugging or non-GUI testing.

    • getTotalShares

      public int getTotalShares()
      Retrieves the most recently recorded number of available shares.
      Returns:
      last value in the trackedShares list
